message.content:
cs.CR, cs.SE, cs.SY, cs.CYBER, cs.DC. 

The paper discusses the vulnerabilities of Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs) and proposes a system for detecting safety and security faults in PLC systems. This topic falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR) as it deals with the security of industrial control systems. Additionally, the paper also discusses the application of the proposed system in a smart building, which falls under the category of software engineering (cs.SE) and cyber-physical systems (cs.SY). The paper also mentions common attacks on PLCs, which falls under the category of cybersecurity (cs.CYBER) and the use of PLCs in critical infrastructures, which falls under the category of distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DC).
